channel.title: "the .net" question?
channel.description:
can u program a class in say c#.net and use it in a vb.net app? or say a asp.net c# class and use it in a windows desktop c# app?
because my teacher says thats how .net works yet i cant get it to work... he wants us to create a simple c# facebook messaging desktop app. so i find 2 c# facebook sdks. the official one and one from codeplex. i think it is for developing server-side code wrote in c#.
ive been looking at how to make a facebook app and stuff; my teacher i believe hasnt even took a glance at it.
tl;dr - is the facebook c# sdk for desktop or web development? and can .net classes of different .net languages be used interchangeably in different languages, such as c# in a vb project?(im talking about taking a .dll created in c# and using it in a vb project, b/c i cant get it to work)
thx
edit: if u rename a thread does that remove any posts? i wouldnt think it would but b4 i read my thread it said someone commented then after i changed the name there was no replies, i just assume they deleted their post.

item.title: "the .net" question?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

i fixed it. it was extremely simple but i shouldnt have had to fix it, it should have been in working order when facebook released the example the problem was the namespace of the sdk was Facebook, but they had in the example referencing FacebookAPI.

EDIT:
ok referencing c# classes from a C# project is easy but now i cant reference the dll in my vb project… i would just do it all in c# but no my teacher wants us to use the languages interchangeably… its should be extremely simple, y isnt it u add the dll to ur project, add it as a reference, and use the import keyword for the namespace of the dll classes,? but no obviously it isnt that simple… he wants use to make a c# wrapper class then reference that class. i dont understand why that will work any different than just using the dll. i have made 2 projects in the same solution one vb the other c#, i added the c# source code thinking i could reference it like that… no i can i never had any problems working with java i cant wait till we get to our java course.

edit2:
got it all working now. the c# target was .net 4.0, and the vb form i was making was set to .net 4.0 client profile. so i just set the target to .net 4.0 and it all works now.

Read full topic

item.title: "the .net" question?
item.dc:creator: @Fire_capez Fire capez
item.description:
@Fire_capez wrote:

[quote=“xryz, post:3, topic:408020”]ok can u point me to a tut online how to get this to work b/c obviously im not doing something correct… i added the dll to my project and added it as a reference, and i get nothing i despise using microsoft stuff, i always have bad experiences with their products but since they have a monopolistic hold on software production. my mission as a future programmer is to make software that just works(maybe im not looking in the correct places but i seems to always find software that is just done wrong, and i want to make sure whom ever uses my products will experience computing the way it should be).

thx for the response.

note: i followed https://github.com/facebook/csharp-sdk/blob/master/readme.md : getting started word for word and VS can not resolve the reference FacebookAPI even though i did exactly what it says to do…[/quote]

Unfortunately I don’t currently know much about the .net framework, I found an article on wikipedia providing information about dynamic linking libraries, which you can find here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dynamic-link_library#Microsoft_Visual_Basic it provides source code and information on how to implement a dynamic linked library in visual basic.

As for the Facebook problem I don’t know sorry, I will take a better look tommorow when I have time.

Read full topic

item.title: "the .net" question?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

ok can u point me to a tut online how to get this to work b/c obviously im not doing something correct… i added the dll to my project and added it as a reference, and i get nothing i despise using microsoft stuff, i always have bad experiences with their products but since they have a monopolistic hold on software production. my mission as a future programmer is to make software that just works(maybe im not looking in the correct places but i seems to always find software that is just done wrong, and i want to make sure whom ever uses my products will experience computing the way it should be).

thx for the response.

note: i followed https://github.com/facebook/csharp-sdk/blob/master/readme.md : getting started word for word and VS can not resolve the reference FacebookAPI even though i did exactly what it says to do…

Read full topic

item.title: "the .net" question?
item.dc:creator: @Fire_capez Fire capez
item.description:
@Fire_capez wrote:

The C# Facebook sdk works with both web (asp.net) and desktop applications. Yes you can use work from a language in the .net framework, in another language of the .net framework by using a dynamic linking library (dll). You must import the dll into your project.

Read full topic
